title: 1919 New Zealand rugby league season
text:
The 1919 New Zealand rugby league season was the 12th season of <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> that had been played in New Zealand.
International competitions.
<a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> toured Australia, losing four matches to <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> and twice to <a href="Queensland%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a>. New Zealand's final two tour games were wins in Rockhampton and Toowoomba. They were captained by <a href="Karl%20Ifwersen">Karl Ifwersen</a>.
New Zealand then hosted <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a>, in the Kangaroos first tour to New Zealand. New Zealand lost the first Test in Wellington 44-21 before bouncing back 26-10 in the second. However they lost the final two to lose the series 1-3. The squad for the four Test matches was; <a href="Craddock%20Dufty">Craddock Dufty</a>, <a href="George%20Iles">George Iles</a>, <a href="Karl%20Ifwersen">Karl Ifwersen</a> (c), <a href="George%20Bradley%20%28rugby%20league%29">George Bradley</a>, <a href="Alec%20Morris">Alec Morris</a>, <a href="John%20Lang%20%28New%20Zealand%29">John Lang</a>, <a href="George%20Neal%20%28rugby%20league%29">George Neal</a>, <a href="Bill%20Scott%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bill Scott</a>, <a href="Bill%20King%20%28New%20Zealand%29">Bill King</a>, <a href="Bert%20Avery">Bert Avery</a>, <a href="Bill%20Williams%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bill Williams</a>, <a href="Sam%20Lowrie">Sam Lowrie</a>, <a href="Stan%20Walters%20%28rugby%20league%29">Stan Walters</a>, <a href="Jim%20Sanders%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jim Sanders</a>, <a href="Mike%20Pollock%20%28rugby%20league%29">Mike Pollock</a>, <a href="Keith%20Helander">Keith Helander</a>, <a href="Bill%20Davidson%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bill Davidson</a>, <a href="Dougie%20McGregor">Dougie McGregor</a>, <a href="Bill%20Walsh%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bill Walsh</a>, <a href="Tom%20Haddon">Tom Haddon</a>, <a href="Ivan%20Stewart%20%28rugby%20league%29">Ivan Stewart</a>, <a href="Nelson%20Bass">Nelson Bass</a> and <a href="Wally%20Somers">Wally Somers</a>.
<a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a> lost to Australia 32-8 at the <a href="Auckland%20Domain">Auckland Domain</a> in front of an estimated 20,000 spectators. Australia also defeated <a href="Waikato%20rugby%20league%20team">South Auckland</a> 58-5, <a href="Hawke%27s%20Bay%20rugby%20league%20team">Hawke's Bay</a> twice, 67-4 and 73-7 and scored 93 points against <a href="Wellington%20rugby%20league%20team">Wellington</a>, defeating them 93-5. The Auckland side included; <a href="Bill%20Davidson%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bill Davidson</a>, <a href="Dougie%20McGregor">Dougie McGregor</a>, <a href="Thomas%20McClymont">Thomas McClymont</a>, <a href="Karl%20Ifwersen">Karl Ifwersen</a>, George Davidson, <a href="Ivan%20Stewart%20%28rugby%20league%29">Ivan Stewart</a>, Billy Ghent, <a href="Stan%20Walters%20%28rugby%20league%29">Stan Walters</a>, <a href="Sam%20Lowrie">Sam Lowrie</a>, <a href="Bill%20Williams%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bill Williams</a>, <a href="Bert%20Avery">Bert Avery</a>, <a href="Bob%20Mitchell%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bob Mitchell</a> and <a href="Nelson%20Bass">Nelson Bass</a>. Reserves; <a href="George%20Iles">George Iles</a>, <a href="Frank%20Delgrosso">Frank Delgrosso</a>, <a href="Jim%20Clark%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jim Clark</a> and <a href="Ernie%20Herring">Ernie Herring</a>.
<a href="Henry%20Thacker">Henry Thacker</a> was elected the patron of the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Rugby%20League">New Zealand Rugby League</a> during the season.
National competitions.
Northern Union Cup.
<a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a> again held the <a href="Northern%20Union%20Cup">Northern Union Cup</a> at the end of the season. A Cup defence against the <a href="Hawke%27s%20Bay%20rugby%20league%20team">Hawke's Bay</a> was played at <a href="Eden%20Park">Eden Park</a>. This was the first rugby league match played at the ground since 1912 and the last until the <a href="1988%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1988 World Cup</a> final. Auckland, who won 38-13, included <a href="Frank%20Delgrosso">Frank Delgrosso</a>, George Davidson, <a href="Dougie%20McGregor">Dougie McGregor</a>, <a href="George%20Iles">George Iles</a>, <a href="Craddock%20Dufty">Craddock Dufty</a>, <a href="Bert%20Laing">Bert Laing</a>, <a href="George%20Neal%20%28rugby%20league%29">George Neal</a>, <a href="Keith%20Helander">Keith Helander</a>, <a href="Sam%20Lowrie">Sam Lowrie</a>, V Thomas, <a href="Tom%20Haddon">Tom Haddon</a>, L Newdick and <a href="Bert%20Avery">Bert Avery</a>.
Inter-district competition.
<a href="Canterbury%20rugby%20league%20team">Canterbury</a> defeated the <a href="West%20Coast%20rugby%20league%20team">West Coast</a>, 5-3.
Club competitions.
Auckland.
<a href="Ponsonby%20Ponies">Ponsonby</a> won the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland Rugby League</a>'s competition. Newton won the Roope Rooster.
The <a href="Marist%20Saints">Marist Brothers Old Boys club</a> was founded in 1919, playing matches at the <a href="Auckland%20Domain">Auckland Domain</a>. Conrad McDevitt, who helped found the club, had earlier been involved with the formation of the Railway XIII side in 1917. Marist's first match was a 3-28 loss to Newton.
Grafton included <a href="Karl%20Ifwersen">Karl Ifwersen</a>.
Ponsonby included <a href="James%20Lawrence%20O%27Brien">Jim O'Brien</a>, <a href="Jim%20Clark%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jim Clark</a>, <a href="Sam%20Lowrie">Sam Lowrie</a>, <a href="Walter%20Milne%20%28rugby%20league%29">Walter Milne</a>, captain <a href="Thomas%20McClymont">Thomas McClymont</a>, <a href="Bill%20Walsh%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bill Walsh</a> and <a href="Frank%20Delgrosso">Frank Delgrosso</a>.
The <a href="City%20Rovers">City Rovers</a> included <a href="Bill%20Davidson%20%28rugby%20league%29">Bill Davidson</a>, <a href="Ivan%20Stewart%20%28rugby%20league%29">Ivan Stewart</a>, and <a href="Bert%20Laing">Bert Laing</a>.
The <a href="Ellerslie%20Eagles">Ellerslie United Rugby League Club</a> was reestablished on 26 July 1919 after going into recess with the outbreak of World War I.
Wellington.
Petone won the <a href="Wellington%20Rugby%20League">Wellington Rugby League</a>'s Appleton Shield.
Canterbury.
Sydenham won the <a href="Canterbury%20Rugby%20League">Canterbury Rugby League</a>'s competition, for which they were awarded the <a href="Thacker%20Shield">Thacker Shield</a>.
Templeton and Kaiapoi joined the League while Addington regained senior status.
Other Competitions.
The <a href="West%20Coast%20Rugby%20League">West Coast Rugby League</a> was reestablished by J.D.Wingham after being in recess since 1915. Blackball, Kohinoor and Runanga competed in the competition.
